description.value: The FLACC (Faces, Legs, Activity, Cry and Consolability) is a pain assessment tool, that is used to assess pain in children aged 0-7 years old by observing their behaviour. The FLACC has five subscales that need to be addressed. The final score indicates whether the observed child suffers pain and 'how much'. The score is often combined with a NRS-score that is completed by the nurses on basis of clinical experience.

purpose.value: A derived profile from [zib-FLACCpainScale](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-FLACCpainScale) to provide a version better suited for implementation purposes. This profile augments the base profile with elements found in the various use cases that have adopted the zib.
